title: Jungle mobs need  nerfs in damage or something
body:
Being a player who's secondary role is jungle. I think that the jungle mobs need a nerf in damage or increase the sustain you get from hunters machete...A lot of junglers (for example elise and rengar) have a really hard time in the new jungler..if you don't have any good innate sustain you will have to recall as soon as you get your first buff and thats just not right.

I want to jungle..but with the way it is now...theres no point...i'll get executed 3 times in the first 5 minutes unless i play someone like aatrox or warwick. New junglers will be turned away with how stupidly unforgiving it is as well

replies.body:
Easy Jungling:

Always start in the Krugs camp. Smite the ancient Krug and get a leash if you can. Krug's bonus will stun and deal bonus damage with every 5 attacks which can greatly improve your sustain if the big monster is being stunned every 5-8 seconds. 

Be wary of which point you spend at spawn. Dumping a point into Fiora's Q, Lunge, might not be as effective with Krugs buff as her E, which raises attack speed by a huge margin, might be. 

Always kill the big monster first. Machete regen passive remains active even when you're fighting the little monsters. Take out the big guy to mitigate a lot of the damage and allow your Machete passive to spool up a bit while you fight the little guys.

NEVER FIGHT THE RAZORBEAKS. 

It's just not worth it. Unless you're a jungler with crazy fast clearing speed, you're going to have at least 2 camps up, one of them being Razorbeaks. Fighting a high damage monster with 3 other high damage little monsters just isn't worth it unless you are stupid tanky. 

Monster Order: Krugs > Red > Blue > Gromp > Murkwolves. Rift scuttler is also worth taking down once you get devourer enchantment, considering it is classed as a Large Monster.
This, except if you need blue first go frog then blue.

> This, except if you need blue first go frog then blue.

All the cool kids do Krugs... You wanna be cool, right?

;)
thats great and all but i shouldnt have to go gromp/krugs before the buff, razorbeaks shouldnt be op. On top of that 2 potions is not enough, especially wen they give you so little in return

The jungle has changed. 

You don't have to go krugs or gromp first,  just like you didn't have to go blue or red first in the old jungle - it's simply the optimal path. Gromp gives you level 2, blue doesn't - so why not start gromp,  so you don't have to solo a camp at level 1.

You're meant to back early. The point being after 3 camps you can upgrade your machete and get a couple more health potions. Upgraded smite is a part of the new jungle,  you're meant to get it asap. 

Razorbeaks are OP, it's unfortunate. I think the reason is that aoe champions can kill them far too quickly once you get to mid game. So they need to be stronger early so they aren't just free gold/xp later. That said,  I still go to them after level 4 or 5. I also think they should be better to target for aoe junglers than they are;  they should have more health on the smaller ones and do less damage,  so that aoe junglers can kill them as easily as single target junglers clear gromp/krugs. 

This is the preseason,  a chance to learn new routes that are more effective. Optimal strategies will evolve. We'll see a time when people oppose starting at the buffs - why would I waste 30sec of a buff on clearing camps when I don't need it? It felt awkward in the past on a blue dependent jungler to take blue buff when still at nearly full mana,  it would be more efficient to take it at lower mana as I do now. 

You're not meant to do the jungle the same way. You're also going to experience some junglers being weaker than they were before and hopefully they'll be brought back up to par for the start off season 5.

blue/red still get you level 2. Thats not the point though, i shouldnt absolutely HAVE to take gromp/krugs first (which seems is becomming the norm and even though you said you don't have to...you pretty much have to) I get that doing wolves first might not be optimal but i think i should have a choice on wether to do gromp/blue/wolves or red/razorbeaks/krugs or any other combination.

Most junglers have to recall after their second camp. Some champs have to recall right after red/blue/first camp since they can't beat any others with 3/4 health
On top of that there are a lot of junglers that just wont fit no matter how hard you try and that's unfair...i felt in s4 i could pick up ANY jungler and do well with them...in the preseason (yes ik its preseason and nothing is set in "stone" yet...though sometimes it feels like it) you can't do that anymore

I just don't understand much of this particular problem you possess. As oppose to what? Last season where you basically absolutely HAD to start blue? This season you have basically three choices, last season, pretty much one choice. 

The jungle is in a rough place, there's no denying that, but there's incredibly more flexibility, based on your champion, you can start Krugs, Gromp, or Blue. 

How is that a bad thing?

As far as difficulty goes, any jungler still can hold its own, albeit difficult, but nonetheless capable. I've played at least every jungler in this new jungle and I've been able to clear 4 or 5 jungle camps before having to back. 

You need to throw the old style of jungling out the window, its not going to work, and quite frankly, that's fine, there were a lot of problems unable to be rectified with the old jungles, such as ironically, being forced to run the same jungle route no matter what champion you played as. Many of the problems with this new jungles are just merely number tweaks, which are easier to cope with.  



> The trick is a spell vamp quint. Then she does fine.

I wonder how long it takes before people realize she is more then okay if you just run spell  vamp quints on her. Hell, I've found her mid-game clears to be the fastest of any jungler mid-game once you have Q and E maxed. And I'm not exaggerating. The argument people have given me for not running spell vamp on her is that she loses damage, but on the flip side, you're actually capable of ganking consistently, something almost no other jungler can do efficiently currently.

> I just don't understand much of this particular problem you possess. As oppose to what? Last season where you basically absolutely HAD to start blue? This season you have basically three choices, last season, pretty much one choice. 

Last season it was because of the gold and exp you gained from the buff monsters.
If you didn't kill it, it was at risk of being stolen.
Same thing this tme around though not quite as bad.
buff monsters still give the most exp but its not mandatory.

Almost everyone goes back at level 3.
Come the machete changes, everyone goes back at 3 for the extra gold.
Counter jungling will screw you hardif you dont have high mobility to secure camps.

All i need is a single ward and I immediately know someone's route and what buff to steal.

The argument people have given me for not running spell vamp on her is that she loses damage, but on the flip side, you're actually capable of ganking consistently, something almost no other jungler can do efficiently currently. 

Evelyn has always had some of the fastest clearing, but that's not the issue, the issue is being able to clear THEN gank.
Or gank THEN clear.
If you're running spellvamp quints on her you are losing out on damage and she has terrible early game damage.
So you ruin a qint, thats 5 AP you're missing out on.
Seems to not be much until you remember her ratios scale with rank.

The key to beating evelynn is to go into her jungle and rob her of everything.
She can't stop you anymore.

In return, it becomes possible to do Gromp > Blue > Wolves or Krugs > Razorbeaks > Red or  Krugs > Red > Blue before recalling without a leash. With a light leash it is possible to go Gromp > Blue > Red.

Not having a predictable jungle path can help a lot with people trying to invade you.

And for ganks, Stalker's Blade makes up for the loss of kill potential relative to last season when I did use 3 AP quints quite nicely.

Stalker's blade is nice, but I am not fond of it because ranger's trailblazer provides you sustain and allows you to gank more often.
While you can have a more effective gank with stalker's blade, your clearing tends to suffer.
Most character's who are considered top tier in the jungle do not have this issue.
Evelyn also suffers the issue of being really mana intensive as well.
So ranger's becomes even more important for the mana regen.

I solve her mana issues with a {{item:1027}} around level 9 which is when it usually starts being a problem. It later gets built into {{item:3057}} and then into {{item:3078}}. Her passive gives extra mana regen based on max mana, so flat mana items help both pool size and regen.

maybe i need to jungle more but in my experience (playing and watching fellow junglers) it's quite tough..maybe that's because we havn't gotten used to the changes yet, who knows. I just think that the damage certain jungle monsters do should be nerfed a bit...Not so that jungle is "omg so ez" but is slightly less stressful for one and so people who are either new, returning or would like to learn how to jungle don't give up because of its difficulty. (ive seen new players in the old jungle get executed more than once...with tougher and a bit more unforgiving mobs in the new jungle, theyll probably get executed more than twice)

Now you quote someone (not sure who it is, can't find that sentence in this discussion) with spell vamp quints, referring to a female champ and would like to know...who is this champ? x3 elise? evelynn?

I can't comment on red.
On blue,  unless they made a change or a typo in the patch notes for 4.20, blue does not get you enough xp for level 2 from that camp alone. I suppose it could have changed though. 

With respect to clearing camps... I don't know who you're playing.  I main hecarim when I do jungle,  he's been the subject of many complaints on the boards for suffering heavily.  I choose to do 3 camps then back (gromp - wolves - blue), but I can do 5 camps before backing if I get a decent leash on gromp (gromp,  heal with w from allies and smite,  wolves,  blue,  smite red for the heal,  krugs). I base after 3 because otherwise I'm simply way too low health after blue that any laner could come kill me if they threw down a ward in my red jungle. 

I've also seen a lulu jungle in this preseason.  I have no idea how her clears went,  but she was one of the better players on her team by the end of the game. If a lulu can manage the jungle,  I find it hard to believe there are many champions who can't.

gromp > blue > wolves -> recall, upg smite and max potions -> red -> razorbeak (smite for vision buff) -> gank

thats how you jungle now, get used to it.
One way they can make the jungle harder without making the machete regen. negligible is by lowering the damage slightly and increasing the HP of monsters.

Elise does fine but its easy to mess up.
Same for Rengar.
Evelynn...evelynn is  a trick.

> Evelynn...evelynn is  a trick.

The trick is a spell vamp quint. Then she does fine.

Razorbacks are not that bad, You just need to kill the camp in a different order then what people are used to.

Kill the small ones first then the biggie. The little ones do way more damage then the large one.
there is a narrow list of junglers than excel and you will be harshly punished if you deviate from that group
Machete should cost less. Need 3 pots (at least) not 2.
